TypeSignature.Value: Public NotInheritable Class MotionEvent.PointerCoords Inherits Object
public: ref class MotionEvent::PointerCoords sealed : Java::Lang::Object
.class nested public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MotionEvent/PointerCoords extends Java.Lang.Object

remarks.para:
Transfer object for pointer coordinates.
Objects of this type can be used to specify the pointer coordinates when creating new MotionEvent objects and to query pointer coordinates in bulk.
Refer to InputDevice for information about how different kinds of input devices and sources represent pointer coordinates.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Orientation { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Orientation : single with get, set

Docs.summary: The orientation of the touch area and tool area in radians clockwise from vertical.

remarks.para: The orientation of the touch area and tool area in radians clockwise from vertical. An angle of 0 radians indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented upwards, is perfectly circular or is of unknown orientation. A positive angle indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented to the right. A negative angle indicates that the major axis of contact is oriented to the left. The full range is from -PI/2 radians (finger pointing fully left) to PI/2 radians (finger pointing fully right).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Pressure { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Pressure : single with get, set

Docs.summary: A normalized value that describes the pressure applied to the device by a finger or other tool.

remarks.para: A normalized value that describes the pressure applied to the device by a finger or other tool. The pressure generally ranges from 0 (no pressure at all) to 1 (normal pressure), although values higher than 1 may be generated depending on the calibration of the input device.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Size { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Size : single with get, set

Docs.summary: A normalized value that describes the approximate size of the pointer touch area in relation to the maximum detectable size of the device.

remarks.para: A normalized value that describes the approximate size of the pointer touch area in relation to the maximum detectable size of the device. It represents some approximation of the area of the screen being pressed; the actual value in pixels corresponding to the touch is normalized with the device specific range of values and scaled to a value between 0 and 1. The value of size can be used to determine fat touch events.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float ToolMajor { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.ToolMajor : single with get, set

Docs.summary: The length of the major axis of an ellipse that describes the size of the approaching tool.

remarks.para: The length of the major axis of an ellipse that describes the size of the approaching tool. The tool area represents the estimated size of the finger or pen that is touching the device independent of its actual touch area at the point of contact. If the device is a touch screen, the length is reported in pixels, otherwise it is reported in device-specific units.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
